entries.name: ARP Redshift Law (derived mapping)
entries.description: A redshift-like relaxation emerges when an ARP-governed transport variable is mapped to a normalized deficit observable.

entries.name: BZ-Averaged Phase-Lifted Complex Conductance Update (Entropy-Gated)
entries.source: derived: Core Eqs 2–4, 6–7, 10–11 + Leaderboard #3 + #10 (chat: PR Root Guide convo 2026-02-22)
entries.description: Canonical entropy-gated Phase-Lifted ARP conductance update. Single traceable boxed equation with 4 supporting definitions (all from Core + #3/#10). Entropy dynamics are 2nd-law safe; BZ ruler self-consistency feeds a uniform m_eff into QWZ preserving the single Chern jump.

entries.name: AHC Parity Flip-Rate (locking observable)
entries.description: The key AHC observable: fraction of consecutive steps where parity flips. AHC prediction: r_b drops when α_π/μ_π is high enough ('parity locking'). This is the primary testable quantity for the qubit Berry-loop experiment.

entries.name: BZ-Averaged Ruler Coupling for Single-Jump QWZ Transition
entries.description: BZ-average removes k-oscillation: <(1+ε cosλ)^{-1}> = (1-ε^2)^{-1/2}, giving a uniform m_eff(ε) and a single Chern jump at ε_c (for m0=-1: ε_c=√3/2).

entries.name: AHC Adaptive Step-Limit Update (πₐ clip)
entries.description: Core AHC innovation: clip the residual to adaptive bounds ±πₐ. Prevents single-run glitches from causing a branch jump. The key robustness mechanism.

entries.name: pi_a-Modulated QWZ Mass (momentum-dependent; re-entrant transitions)
entries.description: Couples the QWZ topological mass to the adaptive ruler, making m_eff depend on k_x; numerically produces multiple gap closings and re-entrant Chern sectors.

entries.name: AHC Running Winding + Parity
entries.description: Live winding number and parity from the lifted-phase trajectory. w_k counts total accumulated windings; b_k = (-1)^w_k gives the sheet parity at each step.

entries.name: Phase-Coupled Stability Threshold Law

Predicts a sharp stability/transition-like behavior when ÃƒÅ½Ã‚Â¸_R approaches half-integer multiples of ÃƒÂÃ¢â€šÂ¬ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ã‚Â (maximal sinÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â²). Assumptions: ÃƒÅ½Ã‚Â¸_R,ij is a Phase-Lifted (unwrapped) phase-like observable for edge current; ÃƒÂÃ¢â€šÂ¬ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ã‚Â sets the relevant phase period; ÃƒÅ½Ã‚Â» has units 1/time.

entries.name: AHC Adaptive πₐ Update (discrete)
entries.description: Discrete version of πₐ dynamics for the AHC loop: widens bound after events (α_π S_k term), relaxes toward π₀ otherwise.

entries.name: ARP Redshift Law with Bounded Oscillatory Steering
entries.description: A redshift-relaxation bypass law with bounded oscillatory steering. Keeps ARP exponential approach while adding controlled wobble without sign flips when epsilon is constrained.

entries.name: Phase-Lifted Complex Conductance Update
entries.description: Complex-admittance lift of ARP: conductance grows along the instantaneous current phasor direction using a Phase-Lifted (unwrapped) phase. Assumes phase-coherent transport where a complex ~G is meaningful. Optional variant: include a Z2 parity factor b_ij = (-1)^{w_ij} multiplying e^{iÃƒÅ½Ã‚Â¸_R,ij} to model sign flips under branch crossings.

entries.name: AHC Candidate Unwrap (standard 2π lift)
entries.description: Apply standard 2π unwrap to each Ramsey measurement relative to the previous lifted phase. First step of the AHC control loop.

entries.name: AHC Residual
entries.description: Difference between the unwrapped measurement and the previous lifted-phase state. Feeds the step-limit gate.

entries.name: Temperature-Dependent Conductance Law
entries.description: Extends ARP equilibrium with an exponential temperature factor for material sensitivity.

entries.name: AHC Event Stimulus (phase-jump indicator)
entries.description: Binary indicator: 1 when a residual exceeds the current πₐ bound, 0 otherwise. Alternative: curvature-based S_k ∝ |Δ²θ_R|. Triggers πₐ widening.

entries.name: ARP Lyapunov Stability Form
entries.equation_latex: V(x)\ge 0,\ V(0)=0;\ \dot V(x)=\nabla V\cdot \dot x\le -\alpha V(x)
entries.description: Candidate stability proof template for adaptive conductance dynamics.

entries.name: ARP as Gradient Flow in Adaptive-π Geometry
entries.description: Bridge theorem: ARP reinforcement is proportional to edge energy contributions in a πₐ-weighted Dirichlet landscape. ARP is a 'lazy' gradient flow where Ω = π_a/π changes what counts as a short/cheap path. Prediction: increasing πₐ in a region re-routes the ARP backbone away, even under the same boundary forcing. 'πₐ sculpts geodesics; ARP discovers them.'

entries.name: Curve Memory Fine-Structure Emergence
entries.description: Formalizes the emergence of the inverse fine-structure constant (ÃƒÅ½Ã‚Â±ÃƒÂ¢Ã‚ÂÃ‚Â»Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â¹ ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Â°Ã‹â€  137) via resonant harmonic conditions in curve memory, assuming an equilibrium state governed by ARP-influenced boundary dynamics.

entries.name: Shielding Mechanism Law (ARP)
entries.description: Proposes a shielding effect in ARP systems, modeled as a fractional reduction of the external field. The effective field is E_eff = (1 ÃƒÂ¢Ã‹â€ Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ ÃƒÅ½Ã‚Â»)E_ext, while the induced adaptive current follows J_adapt = ÃƒÂÃ†â€™E_ext, with 0 < ÃƒÅ½Ã‚Â» < 1.

entries.name: Parity Pump (πₐ-gradient ℤ₂ flip mechanism)
entries.description: Novel mechanism: parity can flip due to geometry-field motion, not only due to circling a branch point. A Z₂ pump controlled by ln(πₐ) dynamics. Conjecture: if Δθ=0 but ∫ d(ln πₐ) ≠ 0 over a closed loop, admissible lifts exist where b_a flips — the adaptive-π analog of geometric phase without dynamical phase.

entries.name: Unified Dynamic Constants Law
entries.description: First-order linear coupling for adaptive updates of ÃƒÂÃ¢â€šÂ¬ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ã‚Â, e, ÃƒÂÃ¢â‚¬Â¢, and c, expressing networked rates of changeÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Âmodels the unification of ARP, AIN, and ÃƒÂÃ¢â€šÂ¬ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â‚¬Å¡Ã‚Â system parameters.

entries.name: πₐ-Gauged Phase-Lift (adaptive unwrap + invariants)
entries.description: Generalizes Phase-Lift unwrapping from fixed 2π to adaptive 2πₐ: sheet jumps happen in units of the local identification length. Derives πₐ-gauged winding w_a and ℤ₂ shadow parity b_a. Novel: the unit of winding is no longer constant, coupling topology to a geometry field.

entries.name: Redshift-ARP Superconductivity Law
entries.description: Proposes a cosmological scaling for critical superconducting resistance: R_s(z) = R_{s,0} (1+z)^alpha. Assumes layered structure, universal conductance constant, ARP regime dominant.

entries.name: Adaptive Phase-Lift Unwrap Recurrence (pi_a-gauged)
entries.description: Adaptive Phase-Lift recurrence: unwrap arg using local identification length 2π_a (not fixed 2π); yields integer sheet count and Z2 parity tracking.

entries.name: Weighted Dirichlet Energy (ARP learns Omega-geodesics)
entries.description: Graph Dirichlet energy with adaptive-π weights Ω_ij; suggests ARP reinforcement concentrates conductance on Ω-weighted shortest paths / backbones.

entries.name: U(N) Det-Phase on Lifted Branch
entries.description: Same Phase-Lift bookkeeping (integer winding + ℤ₂ shadow) applied to the determinant phase of U(N) holonomy. Bridges the U(1) parity framework to non-abelian gauge systems.

entries.name: Adaptive Connection and Adaptive Chern Number (Theorem B candidate)
entries.description: Defines a rescaled connection Â=A/(2π_a) and curvature F̂=dÂ; C_a is integer-valued when the rescaling is globally well-defined.

entries.name: Parity Pump Law from Adaptive Chern
entries.description: Mod-2 holonomy/parity flip controlled by the integer adaptive Chern invariant.

entries.name: Curve-Memory Integration State (unified closed loop)
entries.description: Defines a unified integration state s(t) = (θ_R, w_a, b_a, π_a, M_k) bundling Phase-Lift, winding/parity, adaptive-π, and curve-memory features. Curve-memory curvature drives π_a, π_a changes phase unwrapping sensitivity, parity flips become detectable stable motifs. Turns topological sheet changes into an event grammar.

entries.name: U(N) Wilson / Holonomy
entries.description: Path-ordered exponential giving the U(N) holonomy around a closed loop γ. Extends the Phase-Lift framework beyond the U(1) case to non-abelian gauge fields.

entries.name: Dimensionless Lifted Phase Flow (pi_a-driven pump term)
entries.description: Defines φ=θ_R/(2π_a) and shows π_a dynamics can drive half-integer crossings (a Z2 pump mechanism) even with smooth θ_R.

entries.name: Adaptive Monodromy Spectrum (bifurcation framework)
entries.description: For loop families γ_λ under πₐ evolution, the Adaptive Monodromy Pair M_a(γ) = (w_a, b_a) ∈ ℤ × {±1} traces out a reachable set that can bifurcate: parity flips occur without classical winding as (α_π, μ_π) or CM thresholds vary. Defines a research program: map bifurcation diagrams of M_a vs parameters.

entries.name: Adaptive Discriminant Set for Parity/Winding Stability
entries.description: Singular set where the lift can fail and winding/parity may change; away from D, w and b are homotopy invariants.

entries.name: Engineered Pinch-to-Transition Mass Drive (single-jump toy)
entries.description: Monotone coupling that forces one Chern jump near ε→1^- (useful as a controllable toy model; clamp to trivial mass after the discriminant).

entries.name: Phase (Adler/RSJ) Dynamics
entries.description: Unwrapped phase difference φ(t) tries to run at detuning Δ, but adaptive coupling λG can pull it into a locked fixed point. Backbone equation of the parity-locking mechanism. Textbook Adler/RSJ form with ARP-adaptive coupling.

entries.name: Generic ARP Reinforce/Decay Law
entries.description: Conductance/coupling G increases with activity A(φ,G) at gain α, and relaxes toward baseline G₀ at rate μ. The workhorse ARP law in its most general continuous-time form.

entries.name: Activity Closure A = G|sinφ| (Parity Lock Mechanism)
entries.description: The same phase mismatch that produces restoring torque (sinφ) also teaches the coupling. This tight self-referential closure is what makes parity locking possible — the key novel ingredient of Paper I.

entries.name: Slip-Regime Asymptote (1/π Signature)
entries.description: When coupling can't lock, φ̇→Δ, so parity flips at a universal rate set by detuning. With Δ=1, r_b = 1/π ≈ 0.3183. This is the falsifiable signature: any experiment measuring parity flip rate in slip must converge to |Δ|/π.

entries.name: Noise-Robust Langevin Extension (Rounded Transition)
entries.description: Adds phase diffusion to the Adler/RSJ dynamics. Locking becomes 'almost locked' with exponentially rare slips; the sharp lock/slip transition rounds but remains detectable via r_b. Essential for any real experimental comparison.

entries.name: QWZ Chern-Insulator Hamiltonian (Reference Form)
entries.description: The canonical 2D Chern insulator (Qi–Wu–Zhang). In Step 2, the simulator realizes the real-space version with open boundaries and a time-dependent effective mass u_eff(t). Fully validated via FHS lattice Chern number in multiple tools.

entries.name: Adaptive Geometry → Effective Mass Channel (Step-2 Coupling)
entries.description: The adaptive-π conformal ruler feeding directly into the QWZ mass term. If u_eff(t) crosses 0 or ±2, the Chern phase can switch — without external tuning, purely via ARP reinforcement + memory. This is Paper I's central claim: geometry drives topology autonomously.

entries.name: Real-Space Chern Marker (Bianco–Resta, Open Boundaries)
entries.description: Computes a local topological marker from the occupied-state projector P. The simulator bulk-averages C(r) over interior sites to estimate the Chern number in an inhomogeneous, adaptive lattice. Standard diagnostic but not yet implemented in the open-boundary sim code.

entries.name: Mesh-Synced Certificate Consistency
entries.description: Chain-level consistency metric for equation certificates across synchronized nodes.

entries.name: Adaptive Entropy Production Rate (AEPR)
entries.equation_latex: dS/dt = sigma_S * sum_ij(G_ij * |I_ij|^2) - kappa_S * (S - S_0) - xi_S * S * r_b
entries.description: Dynamical equation for entropy evolution in adaptive networks: Term 1 — Ohmic dissipation (entropy produced by current flow through G_ij), Term 2 — Thermal relaxation (entropy decays toward baseline S_0), Term 3 — Parity bleed (high parity-flip rate r_b drains entropy, stabilizing the network).

entries.name: Adaptive Entropy Production Rate (AEPR)
entries.description: Dynamical equation for entropy evolution in adaptive networks: Term 1 — Ohmic dissipation (entropy produced by current flow through G_ij), Term 2 — Thermal relaxation (entropy decays toward baseline S_0), Term 3 — Parity bleed (high parity-flip rate r_b drains entropy, stabilizing the network). Closes the EGATL feedback loop by quantifying how topological updates dissipate or harvest entropy.

entries.name: HLATN_White_Paper — eqn 7
entries.description: Conductance ODE with drive, leak, and phase-suppression gate.

entries.name: HLATN_White_Paper — eqn 10
entries.description: Resolved-phase update with wrap-to-\pi and clipping by adaptive bound.

entries.name: HLATN_White_Paper — eqn 11
entries.description: Plaquette holonomy as signed sum of resolved edge phases.

entries.name: HLATN Three-Force Conductance Lock
entries.description: Conductance feedback law combining current-driven reinforcement, linear leak, and a phase-suppression gate keyed to the adaptive angular ruler. Core equation of HLATN framework — drives self-organized topological stabilization.

entries.name: HLATN Phase-Lift Branch-Safe Update
entries.description: Resolved-phase update rule with wrap-to-pi and adaptive clipping. Prevents uncontrolled branch jumps by bounding per-step angular movement to the entropy-regulated ruler pi_a.

entries.name: HLATN Plaquette Holonomy
entries.description: Plaquette holonomy computed as signed sum of resolved edge phases around a plaquette boundary. Combined with winding number w_p = round((Theta_p - Theta_p0)/(2pi)), this defines the Z2 parity locking order parameter.
